paris01-tgv.description: Felix took the TGV to Paris. Felix loved the train, as long as we strolled through the aisles again and again and again. The boy's got good balance.
paris01-tgv.title: Paris01 Tgv

paris02-snow.description: When we got to Paris, it was snowing! We stayed with our friends Lou and Andreas, and their 6-year old daughter Anemone.  Anemone, like Felix, was born on December 11.
paris02-snow.title: Paris02 Snow

paris03-snow.description: Lou dug out some of Anemone's baby snow clothes for Felix, and we all went out for a good snow fight. It very rarely snows in Paris, so everyone was making the most of it.
paris03-snow.title: Paris03 Snow

paris04-snow.description: Anemone and David (Lou's brother) give Felix a sled ride.
paris04-snow.title: Paris04 Snow

paris05-snow.description: The next day, we strolled through the snowy woods. Beautiful!
paris05-snow.title: Paris05 Snow

paris06-play.description: Felix's favorite part of Paris was playing with Anemone. At first, Lou tried to keep him entertained with a big box of baby toys, but Felix really really wanted to play with the playmobiles, the dining set, the doll house, and all the other cool stuff with small parts. Not once did he try to eat a tiny toy; Felix is remarkably thoughtful when it comes to avoiding dangerous behavior.
paris06-play.title: Paris06 Play

paris07-epiphany.description:
December 6 was Epiphany. Lou and David dressed as wise men bearing presents (fairy wings for Anemome, push toy for Felix). Then, we ate the king cake.

Traditionally, a king cake has one "feve" (fava bean) in it; whoever gets the feve is the king. In this house, they baked a cake with 7 feves, so everyone got to be king.
paris07-epiphany.title: Paris07 Epiphany

paris08-epiphany.description:
Anemone, Lou and Harold (with cigarette) gathered around the remains of the king cake.

The French smoke a lot, even around babies. Coming from California, it felt rather shocking. Whenever we were in a room with people smoking, Felix seemed uncomfortable and he tried to go somewhere else. This made going to restaurant difficult (very few restaurants are non-smoking).
paris08-epiphany.title: Paris08 Epiphany

paris09-epiphany.description: The whole royal family:  Andreas (who hurt his arm ice-skating), Anemone, David, Lou, Harold and Prince Felix.
paris09-epiphany.title: Paris09 Epiphany

paris10-epiphany.description:
King Harold and Prince Felix.

Felix is in love with his belly. Whenever he is not wearing overalls, he keeps lifting his shirt and feeling it.
paris10-epiphany.title: Paris10 Epiphany

paris11-beaubourg.description:
After the snow stopped, the mercury kept dropping. That didn't prevent Felix from traipsing through Paris for a little sightseeing. He didn't leave his stoller and the layers of blankets that came with it, not even to shake Jacques Chirac's hand.

Here, Felix poses in front of Beaubourg, the national modern art museum.
paris11-beaubourg.title: Paris11 Beaubourg

paris12-notredame.description:
"euh-GA-d !"

Felix points to a lady feeding the pigeons and spurts out his fancy first French word, "regarde!" (look).

Notre Dame in the background.
paris12-notredame.title: Paris12 Notredame

threegenerations1.description: At Iris' apartment in Nice, the night before Felix and Lucie hopped on the plane back. Ah! The emotion! All three generations together for just a little bit longer... now, if we could just get Iris to look at the camera...
threegenerations1.title: Threegenerations 1

threegenerations2.description: There we go! Oups, now the rest of us are looking off. Ah well.
threegenerations2.title: Threegenerations 2

weregoinghome.description:
In the plane, we were in a "bassinet seat". I highly recommend it for anyone traveling with a baby: the bassinet is a comfortable place to nap, and it doubles as a playpen with a view (though Felix was mostly interested in walking through the aisles, and hanging out in the flight attendants area).

We were in France for a little over 3 weeks, but it felt like 3 months. We packed in so much action!
weregoinghome.title: Weregoinghome

description:
Dean flew back to San Francisco, while Lucie and Felix took a trip to Paris to visit some old friends. Paris was cold cold cold.

Felix's babbling has been very word-like for a while, and now some of it is sounding real. "ma ma ma" does seem to refer specifically to Lucie. Felix's vocabulary clearly has an all-purpose negative, "nan" (sort of between the English No and the French Non), and an all-purpose affirmative "yeah" or "ouai" (sort of between a Yes and a Oui). The first true clear word emerged this week; it's "regarde".

Several times this week, Felix pointed at something noteworthy and exclaimed "Regarde!" ("look!"). The first time was at La Tour d'Aigues, on an early morning stroll to get croissants (he had spotted a cat running through the deserted street). Beside Lucie, several other folks (Francoise, Lou, Michele), unprompted, confirmed that Felix does indeed say "regarde". The boy speaks French!
title: January 12
